intro: Strychnos boinensis, commonly known as the Bornean strychnos, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of the tropical rainforest ecosystem. However, it is not widely studied for its medicinal or economic uses.
